ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to read, write, speak, and listen to basic Arabic.
Verb conjugations, close reading, and basic conversational skills in Arabic.
I learned the alphabet, vocabulary, and simple sentence structures in Arabic
I improved my Arabic from no knowledge to a reasonable amount.
This course taught me the study skills and habits that I need to truly learn a language, and specifically that repetition and taking initiative to practice outside of the classroom is key.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: I developed a solid foundation in Arabic.
Weaknesses: some of the work is so much more tedious than it should've been. There were multiple instances where we had to spend more than an hour listening to and handwriting down 20+ sentences for homework, only to repeat the same exact process because the professor wanted to also see the sentences written in the online platform. Get ready to do a lot of useless work.

Strengths: self-paced, independent learning
Weaknesses: not enough supplementary materials/assignments outside of the textbook. This course relies too heavily on the textbook.
Strengths: You learn a lot, Professor Aziz is very knowledgeable and a joy to learn from; Weaknesses: You learn a lot in a short amount of time

strengths: Aziz can make it fun and gives a lot of extra credit oppurtunities. weakness is Aziz can be very unorganized, give unclear instructions, gave us a project over Thanksgiving break, and often gives busy work and at the start of the semester, HW would genuinely take three hours
I think the asynchronous class days weren't as helpful as they could have been.

Strengths: The classroom community was very strong, and I appreciated the amount of support the teacher offered outside of class in office hours. 

Weaknesses: Giving us more time to review old material would be great.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would, only if you're willing to commit to Arabic.
I would recommend this course to another student, especially if they want to learn a new language from scratch.
Yes, if you want to start learning Arabic, I'd argue this is the best instructor/course. You learn A LOT and from an expert in the language.
Yes. Arabic is a wonderful language, and anyone interested in learning it should start here.

I would recommend this to another student if they had a genuine interest in Arabic since the courseload is rigorous. With that being said, the high courseload also means that if you fully committing to this course means you can learn a lot.
